str2: From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Genitive Masculine Singular

str2: All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
Lineage, ancestry; a family, tribe. As if feminine of a derivative of pater; paternal descent, i.e. a group of families or a whole race.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Perhaps from the same as oros; the sky; by extension, heaven; by implication, happiness, power, eternity; specially, the Gospel.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
Contracted from a primary word; soil; by extension a region, or the solid part or the whole of the terrene globe.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From onoma; to name, i.e. Assign an appellation; by extension, to utter, mention, profess.
